author: Staff Reporter
text:
An adult ‘Black kite’, which was lying on the compound wall of a house in a thickly populated residential area here was rescued and handed over to Forest Department officials recently.

The members of an NGO, People for Animals, received a distress call and rushed to the spot along with an animal rescue team from the Forest Department, led by S. Durai Raj and J. Ramesh. The forest officials administered first aid to the bird.

Since the bird had no external injury, the officials said that the bird might have suffered from dehydration or accidentally touched overhead power line. After the bird recovered, it would be released, they added.

S.S. Davidson, Executive Member of NGO, and Shoba, secretary, accompanied the rescue team to the spot.
title: Bird in distress rescued
